title: 2023 OTN Gully and HFX VR4 receiver offloads
comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG with the ability to offload Innovasea VR4 acoustic receivers. The glider was also equipped with an Airmar 200WX weather station and Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor mounted to masts on top of the float, Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor mounted forward thru-hull and two Innovasea VMTs mounted to the front of the sub assembly with one hydrophone head pointed up, one hydrophone head pointed down. 

The glider will offload VR4 receivers in the OTN Gully and Halifax Line.

This is the serial number of SV3-1071 Wave Glider CCU drybox.

Dual AIS Receiver. Temperature range for operation: -25 to +55 degrees C.
RX Ch1: 156.025 - 161.975 MHz at 25kHz BW
RX Ch2: 156.075 - 162.025 MHz at 25kHz BW

Receives and outputs all standard AIS Messages defined in ITU-R M.1371-5 and anticipated future messages.

raw_relationship.comment:
Electromagnetic water speed sensor mounted thru-hull of SV3-1071. Capable of measuring water speed and temperature. Connects to the CCU.

Had to use SV3-1071 CCU in SV3-1121 hull for 2025 Offloads East mission. So different WSS is connected for 2025.

instrument.long_name: Airmar DX900+ MultiLog (electromagnetic)  water speed sensor
instrument.comment: Electromagnetic - MultiLog Sensor - capable of measuring speed and temperature. Mounted at the forward end of the forward payload bay of Wave Glider, thru-hull. Provides water speed input to the core vehicle.

raw_relationship.comment: Vemco VM4 mounted in towbody attached to sub of SV3-1071. Will be used for ESRF and HaliBT survey and HaliBT, Gully and HFX offloads.

instrument.comment:
VR4-UWM specifically designed to be mounted on a wave glider. Dual receiver channel frequencies - 69 kHz and 180 kHz and benthos underwater modem. 

Towed from the Wave Glider sub on a towfish several meters below water.

Purchased 12/12/2022

data_logger.name: 3MPU SMC2
data_logger.comment:
3MPU for SV3-1071. Ports for: Debug, GPSWaves, RUDICS, GPCTD+DO, C3 pump, C3 sensor, ADCP, Expansion

SMC port forwarding currently set-up for port 30022

SMC software version 2.7.0 (as of July 2021)

vid 2009854698

raw_relationship.comment: VMT mounted to handle of SV3-1071 sub. Hydrophone head pointing up. This will be on the glider for ESRF survey and NCAT and CBS offloads.

instrument.comment: MAP-114, ID: 13885, Never Tx

raw_relationship.comment: VMT mounted to handle of SV3-1071 sub. Hydrophone head pointing down. Used during 2023 ESRF, HaliBT and Offload mission.

instrument.comment:
ID: 1801
Last setting to not transmit 
New VMT we got in April 2022

A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG with the ability to offload Innovasea VR4 acoustic receivers. The glider was also equipped with an Airmar 200WX weather station and Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor mounted to masts on top of the float, Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor mounted forward thru-hull and two Innovasea VMTs mounted to the front of the sub assembly with one hydrophone head pointed up, one hydrophone head pointed down. 

The glider will offload VR4 receivers in the OTN Gully and Halifax Line.

raw_relationship.comment:
Original CCU "SV3-1071" put back in SV3-1071 float for 2023 field season. 

Removed in November 2023 to put in "SV3-1121" hull for Lab Sea work December 2023.
